intro: Vincetoxicum alpinum, commonly known as Alpine Cuckoo's Bill, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Vincetoxicum alpinum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes.
